bigd.h

00001 /* bigd.h */
00002 
00003 /* 
00004 Interface to BIGD library.
00005 
00006 Multiple-precision arithmetic using non-negative numbers
00007 and memory management.
00008 */
00009 /******************** SHORT COPYRIGHT NOTICE**************************
00010 This source code is part of the BigDigits multiple-precision
00011 arithmetic library Version 2.0 originally written by David Ireland,
00012 copyright (c) 2001-5 D.I. Management Services Pty Limited, all rights
00013 reserved. It is provided "as is" with no warranties. You may use
00014 this software under the terms of the full copyright notice
00015 "bigdigitsCopyright.txt" that should have been included with this
00016 library or can be obtained from <www.di-mgt.com.au/bigdigits.html>.
00017 This notice must always be retained in any copy.
00018 ******************* END OF COPYRIGHT NOTICE***************************/

00026 #ifndef BIGD_H_
00027 #define BIGD_H_ 1
00028 
00029 #ifdef __cplusplus
00030 extern "C" {
00031 #endif
00032 
00033 #include <stddef.h>
00034 
00035 /*
00036 This interface uses opaque pointers of type BIGD using
00037 the conventions in "C Interfaces and Implementions" by
00038 David R. Hanson, Addison-Wesley, 1996, pp21-4.
00039 */
00040 #define T BIGD
00041 typedef struct T *T;
00042 
00043 /* DIGIT_T type is not exposed by this library so we expose 
00044    a synonym `bdigit_t' for a single digit */
00045 typedef unsigned long bdigit_t;
00046 
00047 #define OCTETS_PER_DIGIT (sizeof(bdigit_t))
00048 /* Options for bdPrint */
00049 #define BD_PRINT_NL   0x1       /* append a newline after printing */
00050 #define BD_PRINT_TRIM 0x2       /* trim leading zero digits */
00051 
00052 
00053 /* PROGRAMMER'S NOTES
00054 Where the function computes a new BIGD value,
00055 the result is returned in the first argument.
00056 Some functions do not allow variables to overlap.
00057 Functions of type int generally return 0 to denote success 
00058 but some return True/False (1/0) or borrow (+1) or error (-1).
00059 Functions of type size_t (an unsigned int) return a length.
00060 
00061 Memory is allocated if the function might need it. 
00062 It is only released when freed with bdFree(), e.g.:
00063 
00064         BIGD b;
00065         b = bdNew();
00066         ...
00067         bdFree(&b);
00068 */
00069 
00070 /******************************/
00071 /* CONSTRUCTOR AND DESTRUCTOR */
00072 /******************************/
00073 
00074 BIGD bdNew(void);
00075         /* Return handle to new BIGD object */
00076 
00077 void bdFree(BIGD *bd);  
00078         /* Zeroise and free BIGD memory
00079            - NB pass a pointer to the handle */
00080 
00081 /*************************/
00082 /* ARITHMETIC OPERATIONS */
00083 /*************************/
00084 
00085 int bdAdd(BIGD w, BIGD u, BIGD v);
00086         /* Compute w = u + v, w#v */
00087 
00088 int bdSubtract(BIGD w, BIGD u, BIGD v);
00089         /* Compute w = u - v, return borrow, w#v */
00090 
00091 int bdMultiply(BIGD w, BIGD u, BIGD v);
00092         /* Compute w = u * v, w#u */
00093 
00094 int bdDivide(BIGD q, BIGD r, BIGD u, BIGD v);
00095         /* Computes quotient q = u / v and remainder r = u mod v 
00096            Trashes q and r first. q#(u,v), r#(u,v) */
00097 
00098 int bdModulo(BIGD r, BIGD u, BIGD v);
00099         /* Computes r = u mod v, r#u */
00100 
00101 int bdSquare(BIGD w, BIGD x);
00102         /* Computes w = x^2, w#x */
00103 
00104 int bdIncrement(BIGD a);
00105         /* Sets a = a + 1, returns carry */
00106 
00107 int bdDecrement(BIGD a);
00108         /* Sets a = a - 1, returns borrow */
00109 
00110 /* 'Safe' versions with no restrictions on overlap */
00111 int bdAddEx(BIGD w, BIGD u, BIGD v);
00112 int bdSubtractEx(BIGD w, BIGD u, BIGD v);
00113 int bdMultiplyEx(BIGD w, BIGD u, BIGD v);
00114 int bdDivideEx(BIGD q, BIGD r, BIGD u, BIGD v);
00115 int bdModuloEx(BIGD r, BIGD u, BIGD v);
00116 int bdSquareEx(BIGD w, BIGD x);
00117 
00118 /*************************/
00119 /* COMPARISON OPERATIONS */
00120 /*************************/
00121 
00122 int bdIsEqual(BIGD a, BIGD b);
00123         /* Returns true if a == b, else false */
00124 
00125 int bdCompare(BIGD a, BIGD b);
00126         /* Returns sign of (a-b) */
00127 
00128 int bdIsZero(BIGD a);
00129         /* Returns true if a == 0, else false */
00130 
00131 int bdIsEven(BIGD a);
00132 int bdIsOdd(BIGD a);
00133         /* Return TRUE or FALSE */
00134 
00135 /*************************/
00136 /* ASSIGNMENT OPERATIONS */
00137 /*************************/
00138 
00139 int bdSetEqual(BIGD a, BIGD b);
00140         /* Sets a = b */
00141 
00142 int bdSetZero(BIGD a);
00143         /* Sets a = 0 */
00144 
00145 /****************************/
00146 /* NUMBER THEORY OPERATIONS */
00147 /****************************/
00148 
00149 int bdModExp(BIGD y, BIGD x, BIGD e, BIGD m);
00150         /* Compute y = x^e mod m */
00151 
00152 int bdModMult(BIGD a, BIGD x, BIGD y, BIGD m);
00153         /* Compute a = (x * y) mod m */
00154 
00155 int bdModInv(BIGD x, BIGD a, BIGD m);
00156         /* Compute x = a^-1 mod m */
00157 
00158 int bdGcd(BIGD g, BIGD x, BIGD y);
00159         /* Compute g = gcd(x, y) */
00160 
00161 int bdIsPrime(BIGD b, size_t ntests);
00162         /* Returns true if passes ntests x Miller-Rabin tests with trial division, b > 2 */
00163 
00164 int bdRabinMiller(BIGD b, size_t ntests);
00165         /* Returns true if passes ntests x Miller-Rabin tests without trial division, b > 2 */
00166 
00167 /**********************************************/
00168 /* FUNCTIONS THAT OPERATE WITH A SINGLE DIGIT */
00169 /**********************************************/
00170 
00171 int bdSetShort(BIGD b, bdigit_t d);
00172         /* Converts single digit d into a BIGD b */
00173 
00174 int bdShortAdd(BIGD w, BIGD u, bdigit_t d);
00175         /* Compute w = u + d */
00176 
00177 int bdShortSub(BIGD w, BIGD u, bdigit_t d);
00178         /* Compute w = u - d, return borrow */
00179 
00180 int bdShortMult(BIGD w, BIGD u, bdigit_t d);
00181         /* Compute w = u * d */
00182 
00183 int bdShortDiv(BIGD q, BIGD r, BIGD u, bdigit_t d);
00184         /* Computes quotient q = u / d and remainder r = u mod d */
00185 
00186 bdigit_t bdShortMod(BIGD r, BIGD u, bdigit_t d);
00187         /* Computes r = u mod d */
00188 
00189 int bdShortCmp(BIGD a, bdigit_t d);
00190         /* Returns sign of (a-d) */
00191 
00192 /***********************/
00193 /* BIT-WISE OPERATIONS */
00194 /***********************/
00195 
00196 size_t bdBitLength(BIGD bd);
00197         /* Returns number of significant bits in bd */
00198 
00199 int bdSetBit(BIGD a, size_t n, int value);
00200         /* Set bit n (0..nbits-1) with value 1 or 0 */
00201 
00202 int bdGetBit(BIGD a, size_t ibit);
00203         /* Returns value 1 or 0 of bit n (0..nbits-1) */
00204 
00205 int bdShiftLeft(BIGD a, BIGD b, size_t n);
00206         /* Computes a = b << n, n < BITS_PER_DIGIT */
00207 
00208 int bdShiftRight(BIGD a, BIGD b, size_t n);
00209         /* Computes a = b >> n, n < BITS_PER_DIGIT */
00210 
00211 /*******************/
00212 /* MISC OPERATIONS */
00213 /*******************/
00214 
00215 size_t bdSizeof(BIGD b);
00216         /* Returns number of significant digits in b */
00217 
00218 void bdPrint(BIGD bd, size_t flags);
00219         /* Print bd to stdout (see flags above) */
00220 
00221 /***************/
00222 /* CONVERSIONS */
00223 /***************/
00224 
00225 /* NB `octet' = an 8-bit byte */
00226 
00227 size_t bdConvFromOctets(BIGD b, const unsigned char *c, size_t nbytes);
00228         /* Converts nbytes octets into big digit b, resizing if necessary.
00229            Returns number of significant digits actually set. */
00230 
00231 size_t bdConvToOctets(BIGD b, unsigned char *c, size_t nbytes);
00232         /* Convert big digit b into string of octets, in big-endian order,
00233            padding to nbytes or truncating if necessary.
00234            Returns number of significant bytes required for c. 
00235            If c is NULL or nbytes == 0 then just return required size. */
00236 
00237 size_t bdConvFromHex(BIGD b, const char *s);
00238         /* Convert string s of hex chars into big digit b. 
00239            Returns number of significant digits actually set or 0 if error. */
00240 
00241 size_t bdConvToHex(BIGD b, char *s, size_t smax);
00242         /* Convert big digit b into string of hex characters
00243            where s has size smax including the terminating zero.
00244            Returns number of chars required for s excluding leading zeroes. 
00245            If s is NULL or smax == 0 then just return required size. */
00246 
00247 size_t bdConvFromDecimal(BIGD b, const char *s);
00248         /* Convert string s of decimal chars into big digit b. 
00249            Returns number of significant digits actually set or 0 if error. */
00250 
00251 size_t bdConvToDecimal(BIGD b, char *s, size_t smax);
00252         /* Convert big digit b into string of decimal characters
00253            where s has size smax including the terminating zero.
00254            Returns number of chars required for s excluding leading zeroes. 
00255            If s is NULL or smax == 0 then just return required size. */
00256 
00257 /* Note that the bdConvToHex and bdConvToDecimal functions return the 
00258    total length of the string they tried to create */
00259 
00260 /****************************/
00261 /* RANDOM NUMBER OPERATIONS */
00262 /****************************/
00263 
00264 bdigit_t bdRandDigit(void);
00265         /* Generate a pseudo-random digit. Not thread-safe. */
00266 
00267 size_t bdSetRandTest(BIGD a, size_t ndigits);
00268         /* Fill a with _up to_ ndigits pseudo-random digits. Not thread safe. */
00269 
00270 /* TYPEDEF for user-defined random byte generator function */
00271 typedef int (* BD_RANDFUNC)(unsigned char *buf, size_t nbytes, unsigned char *seed, size_t seedlen);
00272 
00273 int bdRandomSeeded(BIGD a, size_t nbits, unsigned char *seed, 
00274         size_t seedlen, BD_RANDFUNC RandFunc);
00275         /* Generate a random number nbits long using RandFunc */
00276 
00277 int bdGeneratePrime(BIGD b, size_t nbits, size_t ntests, unsigned char *seed, 
00278         size_t seedlen, BD_RANDFUNC RandFunc);
00279         /* Generate a prime number nbits long; carry out ntests x primality tests */
00280

00283 #ifdef __cplusplus
00284 }
